title: The Launch: Fashion News to Know This January
description: Here’s what to shop in the new year.
text: It’s officially 2025, which means we’ve semi-recovered from holiday festivities and are turning our focus toward new resolutions. As we begin to look ahead, check out the must-know fashion launches to start your year off on the most stylish foot possible. Below, here’s what you need to know this month, to J.Crew’s new lingerie capsule with Araks to Louis Vuitton’s blast-from-the-past collaboration with Takashi Murakami. J.Crew Collaborates With Arakscourtesy of J.CrewWho: J.Crew and AraksWhat: Capsule collectionWhere: Online at jcrew.comWhy: For the first time ever, J.Crew has teamed up with Araks on a limited-edition capsule collection of lingerie. The assortment combines J.Crew’s classic silhouettes with Araks’s range of bold colors and luxe materials. The partnership also marks a return to the retailer for Araks designer Araks Yeramyan, who was a former member of J.Crew’s in-house design team.J.Crew Araks X J.Crew Beatrice BraletteCredit: Courtesy of J.CrewJ.Crew Araks X J.Crew Aaron PantyCredit: Courtesy of J.CrewJ.Crew Araks X J.Crew Midi Slip Dress in Crepe de ChineCredit: Courtesy of J.CrewLouis Vuitton Brings Back Its Takashi Murakami CollaborationCourtesy of Louis VuittonWho: Louis Vuitton and Takashi MurakamiWhat: Collaboration Where: Online at louisvuitton.com Why: To celebrate the 20-year collaboration between Louis Vuitton and renowned artist Takashi Murakami, Louis Vuitton has released an extensive re-edition of the iconic collaboration, available to shop now. The collection contains more than 200 pieces, all emblazoned with Murakami’s signature take on the LV logo. The pieces vary from small leather goods to travel luggage, so there’s something for everyone.Louis Vuitton LV x TM CarryAll PMCredit: Courtesy of Louis VuittonLouis Vuitton LV x TM LV D-Ring 30mm BeltCredit: Courtesy of Louis VuittonLouis Vuitton LV x TM Monogram Multicolor BB BandeauCredit: Courtesy of Louis VuittonFendi Releases Lunar New Year CollectionOliver JuneWho: FendiWhat: Capsule collectionWhere: Online at fendi.comWhy: To celebrate the upcoming Lunar New Year on January 29, Fendi dropped a new capsule with nods to the Chinese zodiac. The collection includes both menswear and womenswear, with pieces ranging from sweaters and skirts to leather goods—the latter of which come adorned with the brand’s trademark “Monster Eye” motif. Chinese tastemakers Cheng Xiao and brand ambassador Xu Kai star in the campaign.Fendi Lunar New Year White Jersey T-shirtCredit: Courtesy of FendiFendi Lunar New Year Pink Cashmere and Wool Mini-SkirtCredit: Courtesy of Fendi Fendi Lunar New Year Pink Leather BaguetteCredit: Courtesy of Fendi Trove Names New Designer in ResidenceCourtesy, Pamela ZamoreWho: Pamela ZamoreWhat: Designer in Residence at TroveWhere: 301 West 4th Street, New York CityWhy: Fine jewelry designer Pamela Zamore will be January’s Designer in Residence at the recently opened Trove storefront in New York City’s West Village. For the uninitiated, Trove, a premium jewelry box brand, started the program in conjunction with its November store opening as a chance to highlight independent designers each month. Zamore’s 18-karat yellow gold pieces have been worn by the likes of Angelina Jolie and Demi Moore and are beloved for their heirloom weightiness, with modern details. Zamore is also a finalist for the Tiffany & Co. x CFDA Jewelry Designer Award. Trove’s curation of Pamela Zamore jewelry will be available to shop in-store through the end of the month.Pamela Zamore Isla Shield RingPamela Zamore Olo Round Pendant NecklacePamela Zamore Labyrinth EarringsSaint Laurent Opens New Store in MiamiCourtesy of Saint LaurentWho: Saint LaurentWhat: Store openingWhere: 149 NE 40th Street, Miami Why: Saint Laurent has opened its newest store in the heart of Miami’s Design District. The two-level boutique will house both menswear and womenswear collections along with leather goods and fine jewelry. The sleek interior feels true to the brand, with a mix of materials like concrete and wood found on everything from the walls to the furniture, contrasted by bold, tropical hues on the shelves and flooring. Saint Laurent Wrap Dress in Stretch JerseyCredit: Courtesy of Saint Laurent Saint Laurent La Scandale Sandals in Smooth LeatherCredit: Courtesy of Saint Laurent Saint Laurent Mini Voltaire in Box Saint LaurentCredit: Courtesy of Saint Laurent
html:
It’s officially 2025, which means we’ve semi-recovered from holiday festivities and are turning our focus toward new resolutions. As we begin to look ahead, check out the must-know fashion launches to start your year off on the most stylish foot possible. Below, here’s what you need to know this month, to J.Crew’s new lingerie capsule with Araks to Louis Vuitton’s blast-from-the-past collaboration with Takashi Murakami.

J.Crew Collaborates With Araks

Who: J.Crew and Araks

What: Capsule collection

Where: Online at jcrew.com

Why: For the first time ever, J.Crew has teamed up with Araks on a limited-edition capsule collection of lingerie. The assortment combines J.Crew’s classic silhouettes with Araks’s range of bold colors and luxe materials. The partnership also marks a return to the retailer for Araks designer Araks Yeramyan, who was a former member of J.Crew’s in-house design team.

J.Crew Araks X J.Crew Beatrice Bralette

J.Crew Araks X J.Crew Aaron Panty

J.Crew Araks X J.Crew Midi Slip Dress in Crepe de Chine

Louis Vuitton Brings Back Its Takashi Murakami Collaboration

Who: Louis Vuitton and Takashi Murakami

What: Collaboration

Where: Online at louisvuitton.com

Why: To celebrate the 20-year collaboration between Louis Vuitton and renowned artist Takashi Murakami, Louis Vuitton has released an extensive re-edition of the iconic collaboration, available to shop now. The collection contains more than 200 pieces, all emblazoned with Murakami’s signature take on the LV logo. The pieces vary from small leather goods to travel luggage, so there’s something for everyone.

Louis Vuitton LV x TM CarryAll PM

Louis Vuitton LV x TM LV D-Ring 30mm Belt

Louis Vuitton LV x TM Monogram Multicolor BB Bandeau

Fendi Releases Lunar New Year Collection

Who: Fendi

What: Capsule collection

Where: Online at fendi.com

Why: To celebrate the upcoming Lunar New Year on January 29, Fendi dropped a new capsule with nods to the Chinese zodiac. The collection includes both menswear and womenswear, with pieces ranging from sweaters and skirts to leather goods—the latter of which come adorned with the brand’s trademark “Monster Eye” motif. Chinese tastemakers Cheng Xiao and brand ambassador Xu Kai star in the campaign.

Fendi Lunar New Year White Jersey T-shirt

Fendi Lunar New Year Pink Cashmere and Wool Mini-Skirt

Fendi Lunar New Year Pink Leather Baguette

Trove Names New Designer in Residence

Who: Pamela Zamore

What: Designer in Residence at Trove

Where: 301 West 4th Street, New York City

Why: Fine jewelry designer Pamela Zamore will be January’s Designer in Residence at the recently opened Trove storefront in New York City’s West Village. For the uninitiated, Trove, a premium jewelry box brand, started the program in conjunction with its November store opening as a chance to highlight independent designers each month. Zamore’s 18-karat yellow gold pieces have been worn by the likes of Angelina Jolie and Demi Moore and are beloved for their heirloom weightiness, with modern details. Zamore is also a finalist for the Tiffany & Co. x CFDA Jewelry Designer Award. Trove’s curation of Pamela Zamore jewelry will be available to shop in-store through the end of the month.

Pamela Zamore Isla Shield Ring

Pamela Zamore Olo Round Pendant Necklace

Pamela Zamore Labyrinth Earrings

Saint Laurent Opens New Store in Miami

Who: Saint Laurent

What: Store opening

Where: 149 NE 40th Street, Miami

Why: Saint Laurent has opened its newest store in the heart of Miami’s Design District. The two-level boutique will house both menswear and womenswear collections along with leather goods and fine jewelry. The sleek interior feels true to the brand, with a mix of materials like concrete and wood found on everything from the walls to the furniture, contrasted by bold, tropical hues on the shelves and flooring.

Saint Laurent Wrap Dress in Stretch Jersey

Saint Laurent La Scandale Sandals in Smooth Leather

Saint Laurent Mini Voltaire in Box Saint Laurent
